page.title: 11THE MARLBOROUGH MOUND
page.content:
There is a mound in the grounds of Marlborough College which is thought to be a prehistoric burial mound; probably the sister mound to the nearby Silbury Hill. There is a local fable that Merlin, the legendary King Arthur's magician was buried under this mound; hence the town's motto under a picture of the mound town hall:
{"UBI NUNC SAPIENTIS OSSA MERLINI";
...where now are the bones of the wise Merlin....
Today a restaurant and Hotel called "The Merlin" keep the link.
It is this earthwork which lends it name to the town's name - "BOROUGH" meaning barrow or burial ground.
